question: 180g of glucose, <katex>$C_{6}H_{12}O_{6}$</katex>, is dissolved in 1 kg of water in a vessel. The temperature at which water boils at 1.013 bar is (given, <katex>$K_{b}$</katex> for water is 0.52K kg <katex>$mol^{-1}$</katex>. Boiling point for pure water is 373.15K)
explanation: Moles glucose = 180/180 = 1 mol. Molality m = 1 mol/1kg = 1 m.
